summary: This is an email chain from May 2020 among personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discussing technical issues with litigation support systems (Relativity/PAE) in relation to the case U.S. v. Epstein, 2018R01618. It reveals internal administrative challenges in processing case materials.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email soliciting feedback on litigation support issues, identified by their title and office affiliation.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document references the criminal case 'U.S. v. Epstein, 2018R01618'.
The correspondence is internal to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing technical problems with litigation support systems (Relativity/PAE).
The issues mentioned include delays in uploading/processing materials, organizational problems, and concerns about handling potentially privileged materials.
The email chain dates from May 6 to May 13, 2020, showing ongoing administrative challenges related to the Epstein case years after his 2019 arrest.
The document is part of a series of records (EFTA00077291-EFTA00077293).
